intro: Varronia oaxacana var. appendiculata, commonly known as the Oaxacan varronia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, followed by elliptical, winged fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
